method.name: Data
method.comment: Returns raw data of vector.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the Vec3F Class 3 dimensional vector of float.

method.name: Data
method.comment: Returns the raw data of vector.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the Vec2I Class 2 dimensional vector of int Type.

method.name: Data
method.comment: Returns the raw data of vector.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the Vec2F Class 2 dimensional vector of float.

method.name: StopTracker
method.comment: Stops the track algorithm. Call start to start the track again.

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes the SurfaceTracker Object

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the SurfaceTracker Class SurfaceTracker occupies one buffer of camera. Use setBufferCapacity of camera to set an amount of buffers that is not less than the sum of amount of buffers occupied by all components. After creation, you can call start/stop to enable/disable the track process. start and stop are very lightweight calls. When the component is not needed anymore, call close function to close it. It shall not be used after calling close. SurfaceTracker inputs InputFrame from inputFrameSink. InputFrameSource shall be connected to inputFrameSink for use

method.name: inputFrameSink
method.comment: InputFrame input port.

method.name: outputFrameSource
method.comment: OutputFrame output port.

method.name: StartTracker
method.comment: Starts the track algorithm.

method.name: Data
method.comment: Returns the ShortBuffer Array

method.name: Limit
method.comment: Returns the ShortBuffer Buffer Limit.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the ShortBuffer class

method.name: Lenght
method.comment: Returns the ShortBuffer's Length.

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the OutputFrame Buffer

method.name: InputFrame
method.comment: Returns the corresponding input frame.

method.name: Results
method.comment: Returns a list of Results of synchronous components.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the OutputFrame Class Output frame. It includes input frame and results of synchronous components.

method.name: output
method.comment: Output port.

method.name: input
method.comment: Input port.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the OutputFrameJoin Class Output frame join. It is used to aggregate output frame from multiple components in parallel. All members of this class is thread-safe.

method.name: output
method.comment: Output port.

method.name: input
method.comment: Input port.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the OutputFrameFork Class Output frame fork. It is used to branch and transfer output frame to multiple components in parallel. All members of this class is thread-safe.

method.name: input
method.comment: Input port.

method.name: signaloutput
method.comment: Output port for frame arrival. It can be connected to InputFrameThrottler.signalInput .

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: There is an output frame input port and output frame fetching function. It can be used to convert output frame fetching from asynchronous pattern to synchronous polling pattern, which fits frame by frame rendering. OutputFrameBuffer occupies one buffer of camera. Use setBufferCapacity of camera to set an amount of buffers that is not less than the sum of amount of buffers occupied by all components. Refer to Overview . All members of this class is thread-safe

method.name: peek
method.comment: Fetches the most recent OutputFrame .

method.name: setMatrix44f
method.comment: Initializes the Matrix44F class Square matrix of 4. The data arrangement is row-major.

method.name: setMatrix44FwithfloatData
method.comment: Initializes the Matrix44F Object with an array of Float data type.

method.name: Data
method.comment: Return The raw data of matrix.

method.name: getMatrix444f
method.comment: Return the Square Matrix of 4.

method.name: image
method.comment: Gets image.

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes the InputFrame Object

method.name: Index
method.comment: Index, an automatic incremental value, which is different for every input frame.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the InputFrame Class

method.name: createWithimageAndCameraParametersAndTemporal
method.comment: Creates an instance with image, camera parameters, and time stamp. Another way of Initializing the InputFrame Class

method.name: cameraParameters
method.comment: Gets camera parameters.

method.name: getInputFrame
method.comment: Returns the InputFrame Object

method.name: output
method.comment: Output port.

method.name: input
method.comment: Input port.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the InputFrameToOutputFrameAdapter Class Input frame to output frame adapter. There is an input frame input port and an output frame output port. It can be used to wrap an input frame into an output frame, which can be used for rendering without an algorithm component. Refer to Overview . All members of this class is thread-safe.

method.name: output
method.comment: Output port.

method.name: input
method.comment: Input port.

method.name: sideInput
method.comment: Side input port for historic output frame input.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the InputFrameTofeedbackFrameAdapter Class There is an input frame input port, a historic output frame input port and a feedback frame output port. It can be used to combine an input frame and a historic output frame into a feedback frame, which is required by algorithm components such as ImageTracker . On every input of an input frame, a feedback frame is generated with a previously input historic feedback frame. If there is no previously input historic feedback frame, it is null in the feedback frame. InputFrameToFeedbackFrameAdapter occupies one buffer of camera. Use setBufferCapacity of camera to set an amount of buffers that is not less than the sum of amount of buffers occupied by all components. Refer to Overview .

method.name: output
method.comment: Output port.

method.name: input
method.comment: Input port.

method.name: signalInput
method.comment: Input port for clearance signal.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the InputFramethrottler Class There is a input frame input port and a input frame output port. It can be used to prevent incoming frames from entering algorithm components when they have not finished handling previous workload. InputFrameThrottler occupies one buffer of camera. Use setBufferCapacity of camera to set an amount of buffers that is not less than the sum of amount of buffers occupied by all components. Refer to Overview . All members of this class is thread-safe.

method.name: connect
method.comment: Connects to input port.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Input frame input port. It is used to expose input port for a component. All members of this class is thread-safe.

method.name: Handle
method.comment: Input data.

method.name: output
method.comment: Output port.

method.name: input
method.comment: Input port.

method.name: Initiallize
method.comment: Initializes the InputFrameFork Class Input frame fork. It is used to branch and transfer input frame to multiple components in parallel. All members of this class is thread-safe.

method.name: image
method.comment: Initializes the Image Class

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the Image Object

method.name: image2
method.comment: Initializes the Image class with a Buffer, preview format, width and height parameters

method.name: Format
method.comment: Returns image format.

method.name: Height
method.comment: Returns Image Height

method.name: buffer
method.comment: Returns buffer inside image. It can be used to access internal data of image. The content of Buffer shall not be modified, as they may be accessed from other threads.

method.name: Width
method.comment: Returns Image Width

class.name: com.genesis.easyAR.ImageTrackerWrapper
class.event: Invoke (Status As Boolean, Name As String, RunTimeID As Int)

method.name: feedbackFrameSink
method.comment: FeedbackFrame input port.

method.name: Start
method.comment: Starts the track algorithm.

method.name: Stop
method.comment: Stops the track algorithm. Call start to start the track again.

method.name: LoadTarget
method.comment: Load a Target into the tracker. A Target can only be tracked by tracker after a successful load. This method is an asynchronous method. A load operation may take some time to finish and detection of a new/lost target may take more time during the load. The track time after detection will not be affected. If you want to know the load result, you have to handle the callback data. The callback will be called from the thread specified by CallbackScheduler . It will not block the track thread or any other operations except other load/unload.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Creates and Initializes the ImageTracker Class

method.name: Dipose
method.comment: Disposes of the Imagetracker Object

method.name: Initialize2
method.comment: Creates and initializes the ImageTracker Class with Mode

method.name: outputFrameSource
method.comment: OutputFrame output port.

method.name: SetSimultaneousNum
method.comment: Sets the number of simultaneous images to track

method.name: result
method.comment: Returns the FrameFilterResult Object

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the FrameFilterResult Object

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: FrameFilterResult is the base class for result classes of all synchronous algorithm components.

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the ImagetrackerResult Object

method.name: trackerResult
method.comment: returns the Result of ImageTracker .

method.name: targetInstance
method.comment: Returns the list of TargetInstance contained in the result.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the ImagetrackerResult class Result of ImageTracker .

method.name: Status
method.comment: Gets the current tracking status.

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the SurfaceTrackerResult Object

method.name: trackerResult
method.comment: Result of SurfaceTracker

method.name: Transform
method.comment: Camera transform against world coordinate system. Camera coordinate system and world coordinate system are all right-handed. For the camera coordinate system, the origin is the optical center, x-right, y-up, and z in the direction of light going into camera. (The right and up, on mobile devices, is the right and up when the device is in the natural orientation.) For the world coordinate system, y is up (to the opposite of gravity). The data arrangement is row-major, not like OpenGL column-major.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the SurfaceTrackerResult Class

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the TargetInstance Object

method.name: Pose
method.comment: Returns current pose of the tracked target. Camera coordinate system and target coordinate system are all right-handed. For the camera coordinate system, the origin is the optical center, x-right, y-up, and z in the direction of light going into camera. (The right and up, on mobile devices, is the right and up when the device is in the natural orientation.) The data arrangement is row-major, not like OpenGL column-major.

method.name: getStatus
method.comment: Returns current status of the tracked target. Usually you can check if the status equals TargetStatus.Tracked to determine current status of the target

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: TargetInstance is the tracked target by trackers. An TargetInstance contains a raw Target that is tracked and current status and pose of the Target .

method.name: target
method.comment: Gets the raw target. It will return the same Target you loaded into a tracker if it was previously loaded into the tracker.

method.name: runTimeID
method.comment: Returns the target id. A target id is a integer number generated at runtime. This id is non-zero and increasing globally.

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the Target Object

method.name: Images
method.comment: Returns a list of target images.

method.name: name
method.comment: Returns the Name of the Target Image

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: initializes the Target Class Target is the base class for all targets that can be tracked by ImageTracker or other algorithms inside EasyAR.

method.name: getScale
method.comment: The scale of image. The value is the physical image width divided by 1 meter. The default value is 1.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: initializes the ImageTarget Class

method.name: Data
method.comment: Returns the float array from the Buffer

method.name: Limit
method.comment: Returns the Buffer limit

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Wraps an array of floats into a Buffer

method.name: Lenght
method.comment: Returns the FloatBuffer length

method.name: output
method.comment: Feedback frame output port. It is used to expose output port for a component. All members of this class is thread-safe.

method.name: input
method.comment: Input port.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Creates and Initializes the FeedbackFrameFork object It is used to branch and transfer feedback frame to multiple components in parallel. All members of this class is thread-safe.

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the DelayedCallBackScheduler Object

method.name: RunOne
method.comment: Executes a callback. If there is no callback to execute, false is returned.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Creates and Initializes the DelayedCallBackScheduler object It is used to delay callback to be invoked manually, and it can be used in single-threaded environments (such as various UI environments).

class.name: com.genesis.easyAR.CameraWrapper
class.event: onPreview (data() As Byte, cam As CustomCamera)

method.name: SetPreviewTexture
method.comment: sets the Surface Texture in which the Camera preview will be shown

method.name: addCallbackBuffer
method.comment: Adds a pre-allocated buffer to the preview callback buffer queue. Applications can add one or more buffers to the queue. When a preview frame arrives and there is still at least one available buffer, the buffer will be used and removed from the queue. Then preview callback is invoked with the buffer. If a frame arrives and there is no buffer left, the frame is discarded. Applications should add buffers back when they finish processing the data in them.

method.name: CameraOrientation
method.comment: Returns the Camera Orientation as an Int

method.name: createWithDefaultIntrinsics
method.comment: creates the CameraParameters with default Intrinsics another way to Initialize the Camera Object

method.name: setPreviewCallbackWithBuffer
method.comment: Sets the Camera Preview Callback with buffer. Installs a callback to be invoked for every preview frame, using buffers supplied with addCallbackBuffer(byte[]), in addition to displaying them on the screen. The callback will be repeatedly called for as long as preview is active and buffers are available. Any other preview callbacks are overridden. The purpose of this method is to improve preview efficiency and frame rate by allowing preview frame memory reuse. You must call addCallbackBuffer(byte[]) at some point -- before or after calling this method -- or no callbacks will received.

method.name: GetCallBack
method.comment: Returns the Callback.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the Camera class, uses the Android Camera1 Class it is used to create a custom camera object

method.name: setParameters
method.comment: sets the Camera Parameters

method.name: SetPreviewCallback
method.comment: Installs a callback to be invoked for every preview frame in addition to displaying them on the screen. The callback will be repeatedly called for as long as preview is active. This method can be called at any time, even while preview is live. Any other preview callbacks are overridden.

method.name: StartPreview
method.comment: Starts capturing and drawing preview frames to the screen. Preview will not actually start until a surface is supplied with setPreviewDisplay(android.view.SurfaceHolder) or setPreviewTexture(android.graphics.SurfaceTexture).

method.name: getParameters
method.comment: Returns the Camera Parameters

method.name: StopPreview
method.comment: Stops capturing and drawing preview frames to the surface, and resets the camera for a future call to startPreview().

method.name: Release
method.comment: Disconnects and releases the Camera object resources. You must call this as soon as you are done with the Camera object.

method.name: setCallback
method.comment: Sets a callBack to the Camera Object, Event will be raised on every Preview Frame

method.name: getCallback
method.comment: Returns the CallBack object

method.name: Get
method.comment: Retrieve any parameter by key name Returns the information as a String

method.name: setFocusMode
method.comment: Sets the Focus Mode

method.name: getPreviewFormat
method.comment: Returns the Camera current preview format

method.name: getPreviewSize
method.comment: returns the Camera Preview size as an array of Int the first element is Width the second element is Height

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Returns the current settings for this Camera service. If modifications are made to the returned Parameters, they must be passed to setParameters(android.hardware.Camera.Parameters) to take effect.

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the CameraParameters Object

method.name: getCameraParameters
method.comment: Returns the CameraParameters object

method.name: cameraParameters
method.comment: Initializes the CameraParameters Class Camera parameters, including image size, focal length, principal point, camera type and camera rotation against natural orientation.

method.name: Projection
method.comment: Calculates the perspective projection matrix needed by virtual object rendering. The projection transforms points from camera coordinate system to clip coordinate system ([-1, 1]^4). The form of perspective projection matrix is the same as OpenGL, that matrix multiply column vector of homogeneous coordinates of point on the right, and not like Direct3D, that matrix multiply row vector of homogeneous coordinates of point on the left. But data arrangement is row-major, not like OpenGL column-major. Clip coordinate system and normalized device coordinate system are defined as the same as OpenGL default.

method.name: ImageProjection
method.comment: Calculates the orthogonal projection matrix needed by camera background rendering. The projection transforms points from image quad coordinate system ([-1, 1]^2) to clip coordinate system ([-1, 1]^4), with the undefined two dimensions unchanged. The form of orthogonal projection matrix is the same as OpenGL, that matrix multiply column vector of homogeneous coordinates of point on the right, and not like Direct3D, that matrix multiply row vector of homogeneous coordinates of point on the left. But data arrangement is row-major, not like OpenGL column-major. Clip coordinate system and normalized device coordinate system are defined as the same as OpenGL default

property.name: Cameraparams
property.comment: Sets the CameraParameters object, another way of initializing the CameraParameter class

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the CameraDevice Object

method.name: openCamereaWithIndex
method.comment: Opens a camera by index.

method.name: inputFrameSource
method.comment: Input frame output port. It is used to expose output port for a component. All members of this class is thread-safe.

method.name: SetFocusMode
method.comment: Sets focus mode to focusMode. Call after a successful open.

method.name: Start
method.comment: Starts video stream capture.

method.name: Stop
method.comment: Stops video stream capture. It will only stop capture and will not change previous set camera parameters.

method.name: openCamerawithType
method.comment: Opens a camera by camera device type.

method.name: SupportSizeCount
method.comment: Gets the number of supported preview sizes. Call after a successful open.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the CameraDevice Object pass the EventName parameter and PreferMode parameters. CameraDevice outputs InputFrame from inputFrameSource. inputFrameSource shall be connected to InputFrameSink for use

method.name: SupportedSize
method.comment: Gets the index-th supported preview size. It returns {0, 0} if index is out of range. Call after a successful open

method.name: cameraSetSize
method.comment: Sets the preview size. The available nearest value will be selected. Call size to get the actual size. Call after a successful open.

method.name: SetBufferCapacity
method.comment: Sets InputFrame buffer capacity.

method.name: Data
method.comment: Returns the complete ByteArray Data

method.name: Limit
method.comment: Returns the ByteArray Limit, similar to Length

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Wraps a Byte Array into a ByteBuffer

method.name: Lenght
method.comment: Returns the ByteArray Length

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes the Buffer Object

method.name: buffer
method.comment: Initializes the Buffer Class

method.name: bufferWrapByteArray
method.comment: Wraps a byte array. The start position and length can be specified. Read-only or read-write can be specified. (Read-only Buffer may be faster on release.) A deleter callback can be specified. When Buffer is released by all holders, deleter callback will be invoked to execute user-defined memory destruction. deleter must be thread-safe.

method.name: CopyToByteArray
method.comment: Copies data from Buffer to a byte array. If copy failed, an exception will be thrown. Possible failure causes includes: source or destination data range overflow.

method.name: bufferSize
method.comment: Returns the Buffer Size

method.name: Dispose
method.comment: Disposes of the BGRenderer class Needs to be closed when exiting the app.

method.name: Render
method.comment: Renders the CameraDevice content along with AR Contents when an Image is tracked, it will Render the 3D Object created in the BoxRenderer Class.

method.name: Upload
method.comment: loads the tracking images converted to byte buffers that will be used to recognize and track the images with the CameraDevice.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: initializes the BGRenderer Class

class.name: com.genesis.easyAR.B4AEasyAR
class.event: Invoke (Status As Boolean, Name As String, RunTimeID As Int)

method.name: EngineResume
method.comment: Handles the app onResume, resumes internal tasks.

method.name: GetScreenRotation
method.comment: Returns the Screen Rotation

method.name: EnginePause
method.comment: Handles the app onPause, pauses internal tasks.

method.name: Pause
method.comment: Pauses the video playback.

method.name: Stop
method.comment: Stops the video playback.

method.name: setVideoType
method.comment: Sets the video type. The type will default to normal video if not set manually. It should be called before open.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the ARVideo Object

method.name: Open
method.comment: Opens a video from path. path can be a local video file (path/to/video.mp4) or url (http://www//video.mp4). storageType indicates the type of path. See StorageType for more description. This method is an asynchronous method. Open may take some time to finish. If you want to know the open result or the play status while playing, you have to handle callback. The callback will be called from a different thread. You can check if the open finished successfully and start play after a successful open

method.name: isRenderTextureAvailable
method.comment: Checks whether video texture is ready for render. Use this to check if texture passed into the player has been touched

method.name: Play
method.comment: Starts or continues to play video.

method.name: updateFrame
method.comment: Updates texture data. This should be called in the renderer thread when isRenderTextureAvailable returns true.

method.name: Close
method.comment: Closes the video.
